title: Requires six points of proof of identification in order to register to vote
summary: Requires six points of proof of identification of name, proof of date of birth and social security card in order to register to vote; directs board of elections to promulgate necessary rules and regulations.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2863

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. CALHOUN, McDONOUGH -- read once and referred to
         the Committee on Election Law

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to requirements for  proof
         of identification for registering to vote

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The election law is amended by adding a new  section  5-108
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  5-108. QUALIFICATIONS OF VOTERS; PROOF OF IDENTIFICATION. NO PERSON
    4  SHALL BE QUALIFIED TO REGISTER FOR AND VOTE AT ANY ELECTION UNLESS  SUCH
    5  PERSON  PRESENTS SIX POINTS OF PROOF OF IDENTIFICATION OF NAME, PROOF OF
    6  DATE OF BIRTH AND SUCH PERSON'S  SOCIAL  SECURITY  CARD.  THE  BOARD  OF
    7  ELECTIONS  SHALL PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT
    8  SUCH SIX POINT PROOF OF IDENTIFICATION SYSTEM.
    9    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02857-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to requirements for proof of identification for registering to vote
